about_the_game:
Build an Australian Football team - choose who to recruit, who to show the door, and who to invest in for the future.

Based on statistically accurate AFL modelling from Squiggle - view a player's career trajectory and decide who to build a team around.

Start in the Bush League with a handful of players, and construct a list that can survive State Leagues and ultimately win the National League premiership.

And do it before the board gets restless!

GAME OVERVIEW

  • Build a list from weekly recruits
  • Make canny player trades to fill list holes and secure the future
  • Pick the eyes out of the post-season draft
  • Delist spuds
  • Heartlessly cut worn-out veterans, or nurture them through their dotage

STREAMLINED MANAGEMENT

You don't have time for fiddly little details. You're a big-picture person.

Choose who to sign and where they play. No contract negotiations. No cry-baby players. No fiddly match-day tactics or surprise injuries.

STREAMLINED GAMEPLAY

A match is 20 seconds. A season is 10 rounds. That gives you time to focus on list management, which is what really matters.

ONLINE DAILY CHALLENGE

Match your eye for talent against the online leaderboard, where everyone starts with the same random seed.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 or AMD Athlon 64 – 1.8 GHz
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Additional Notes: Requires a 64-bit operating system

name: Squiggle Football

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 or AMD Athlon 64 – 1.8 GHz
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: A fast-moving, deck-building list management game. Recruit, trade and delist your way to the national league of Australian Rules Football. With statistically accurate player modelling from Squiggle.
